title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers will occur in most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m.

title: Syrian president arrives in U.S. for meeting with Trump
byline: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa arrived in the U.S. on Saturday for ahead of his landmark meeting with President Trump, his country’s state news agency reported, a day after Washington removed him from a terrorism blacklist.

title: More than 1,400 flights cancelled as US air traffic cuts enter second day
byline: More than 1,400 flights to, from, or within the US were cancelled on Saturday after airlines were told this week to cut traffic during the federal government shutdown.

title: Sri Lanka’s FM explores investment opportunities with leading healthcare provider in Middle East
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, met with the top management of Dr. Sulaiman Al Habib Medical Group, one of the leading healthcare providers in the Middle East.

title: Sri Lanka’s workers’ remittances exceed USD 6 bln in first ten months of 2025
byline: Sri Lanka received USD 712 million in workers’ remittances in October 2025, according to the latest figures released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: 2025 A/L exam to begin tomorrow at over 2,300 centres
byline: The Department of Examinations (DoE) announced that all arrangements have been finalized for the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination, which is set to commence tomorrow (10).

title: Nationwide distribution of 500,000 coconut plants begins today
byline: A national program to distribute 500,000 coconut plants for homestead cultivation is set to commence today (09) with the aim of reducing poverty and promoting coconut cultivation across the country.

title: Rajinikanth to be awarded at IFFI 2025 on completing 50 years of cinema
byline: Rajinikanth is all set to be awarded at the 56th International Film Festival of India (IFFI) on completing 50 years in cinema. IFFI is taking place in Goa, from November 20 to 28.

title: Sri Lanka Customs achieves historic single-day revenue; nears annual target
byline: Sri Lanka Customs says it is on track to meet its annual revenue target for 2025 within the next three days.

title: Fire breaks out at row of shops in Ambalangoda
byline: A fire has reportedly broken out at a row of shops in Ambalangoda, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Welfare Benefits Board issues notice to ‘Aswesuma’ beneficiaries
byline: The Welfare Benefits Board has announced that the annual information updates for the ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit scheme have now commenced.

title: ‘Sarvajana Trust’ inaugurated to promote entrepreneurship and national well-being
byline: The ‘Sarvajana Trust’, established to further the vision of setting up an entrepreneurial state and a happy nation, was inaugurated recently in Colombo.

title: 1 dead, 6 rescued, dozens missing as migrant boat capsizes off Malaysia-Thailand coast
byline: Hundreds were missing on Sunday after a boat sank near the Thailand-Malaysia border, as 10 survivors and one body were recovered, the Malaysian maritime authority said.

title: Woman arrested with 6kg of heroin in Seenigama
byline: A woman has been arrested for the possession of 6 kilograms of heroin in Seenigama, police stated.

title: Six arrested over Seenigama heroin case detained for 7 days
byline: The Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) has taken steps to detain and question six individuals arrested in Seenigama with over 5 kilograms of heroin, for a period of seven days.

title: Seven Sri Lankan drug traffickers in Middle East agree to surrender to authorities - Public Security Minister
byline: Seven Sri Lankan drug traffickers, who are evading arrest and currently residing in the Middle East have agreed to surrender to the authorities.

title: Man held in Puttalam with 3kg of ‘ICE’
byline: An individual has been arrested for the possession of 3 kilograms of crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice’) in Mullai Nagar, Puttalam.

title: Sri Lankan security team departs for Maldives to investigate drug-smuggling vessel
byline: A special team of Sri Lankan security forces has departed for the Maldives to investigate a fishing vessel transporting drugs and its crew, who were taken into custody by Maldivian security forces.

title: Japan hit with 6.7 magnitude earthquake; tsunami warning issued
byline: A powerful earthquake struck off the coast of northern Japan today, shaking buildings across Iwate Prefecture.

title: Police foil drug operation in Maharagama, six arrested
byline: A total of six individuals, including the main suspect have been arrested for packaging and distributing crystal methamphetamine at a house in Pannipitiya, Maharagama, police stated.

title: Three including two sisters arrested over heroin trafficking operation
byline: Three individuals, a male and two females, have been arrested by the police in connection with a heroin trafficking operation.

title: Japan observes tiny tsunami following 6.7 magnitude quake
byline: Japan said on Sunday (Nov 9) evening that tiny tsunami waves hit its northern Pacific coast after an offshore 6.7-magnitude earthquake.

title: Sri Lankan arrested in Rameswaram after traveling to India via boat
byline: A Sri Lankan has been arrested in Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu for allegedly entering India illegally, India media reports said.

title: Seven Sri Lankan drug traffickers in Middle East agree to surrender - Minister
byline: Seven Sri Lankan drug traffickers, who are evading arrest and currently residing in the Middle East have agreed to surrender to the authorities.

title: Myanmar junta says demolishing 150 scam hub buildings
byline: Myanmar’s military said on Sunday (Nov 9) it was demolishing nearly 150 buildings in a crackdown on a notorious internet scam compound bordering Thailand - including a gym, a spa and a karaoke parlour.

title: Nearly a million evacuated as Philippines braces for ‘super typhoon’
byline: More than 900,000 people have been evacuated in the Philippines ahead of Typhoon Fung-wong, which is expected to make landfall on Sunday evening.

title: Feedback on amendments to Finance Business Act accepted till Nov. 30: CBSL
byline: The general public has been requested to provide feedback on the proposed amendments to the Finance Business Act, No. 42 of 2011.

title: Sri Lanka reaffirms unwavering support to Palestine cause
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has reaffirmed Sri Lanka’s traditional and unwavering support to the Palestine cause.

title: 2025 A/L Exam: Strict laws to prevent examination malpractices
byline: All necessary preparations have been completed for the conduct of the 2025 GCE Advanced Level examination, which begins tomorrow, the Department of Examinations has announced.

title: JSC revises qualifications for Magistrate recruitment
byline: The Judicial Service Commission has decided to amend the qualifications for recruitment to the position of Magistrate in the Judicial Service.

title: Saudi issues commemorative stamps to mark 50th anniversary of diplomatic relations with Sri Lanka
byline: Saudi Arabia has issued commemorative stamps to mark the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia.

title: Age-appropriate sex education should be introduced for school children: PM Harini
byline: An age-appropriate sex education program should be introduced for children in order to prevent sexual misconduct and abuse, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Drug circulation in Colombo significantly widespread than previously thought: Minister
byline: Over 800 complaints related to drug use, sale and trafficking have been lodged through the 1818 hotline, introduced to provide information regarding drug trafficking in schools, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala stated.

title: Sri Lanka’s reserves dip slightly in October
byline: Sri Lanka’s official reserve assets recorded a marginal decline in October 2025 compared to the previous month, according to the latest data from the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.
